creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: one of a pair of paintings of angels with symbols of the passion; other is 69.36.2
text: This angel and the one next to it carry symbols of the Passion—the events associated with Jesus Christ’s suffering and death. The pitcher, basin, and cloth represent those used by Pontius Pilate to wash his hands of responsibility for Christ’s crucifixion.
title: Angels with Attributes of the Passion: Angel Holding the Vessel and Towel for Washing the Hands of Pontius Pilate
